result.execSummary:
The defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Huber for work. Court stayed commencement until 06/19/15. Court objects to ES.
Court granted credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $3000.00 by stipulation of the parties, during term of probation or civil judgment to be entered against the defendant.
IF RESTITUTION IS PAID IN FULL AND PROOF IS PROVIDED TO THE COURT, PROBATION CAN TERMINATE EARLY.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Natrina Ciara Shaw

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT 3  Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO  DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
*PAY RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $3000.00 BY STIPULATION OF THE PARTIES , DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT TO BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT.
*ATTEND AN ANGER MANAGMENT CLASS
*ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT. 

IF RESTITUTION IS  PAID IN FULL AND PROOF IS PROVIDED TO THE COURT , PROBATION CAN TERMINATE EARLY. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

AS TO COUNTS TWO AND THREE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNTS ONE AND FOUR:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING. 

Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT TWO:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK. COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 6-19-15. Court objects to ES.

Defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the  Amended complaint  adding counts 3 and 4: Criminal Damage to Property pursuant to 943.01(1)  and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and  Amended complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-18-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 03-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 02-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: JIHAD R AND PIZZA HUT IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Natrina Ciara Shaw in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
